src: Quarterly Labour Force Survey (QLFS).
tgt: Quarterly Labour Force Survey (QLFS).

src: Cabinet welcomed the results of Statistics South Africa’s QLFS for the third quarter of 2022, which indicated that 204 000 jobs were gained between the second and third quarters of 2022.
tgt: Cabinet welcomed the results of Statistics South Africa’s QLFS for the third quarter of 2022, which indicated that 204 000 jobs were gained between the second and third quarters of 2022.

src: The QLFS also revealed that the total number of persons employed in the third quarter of 2022 was 15,8 million.
tgt: The QLFS also revealed that the total number of persons employed in the third quarter of 2022 was 15,8 million.

src: This means that the official unemployment rate decreased by 1,0 percentage point from 33,9% in the second quarter to 32,9% in the third quarter of 2022.
tgt: This means that the official unemployment rate decreased by 1,0 percentage point from 33,9% in the second quarter to 32,9% in the third quarter of 2022.

src: The unemployment rate according to the expanded definition of unemployment also decreased by 1,0 percentage point to 43,1% in the third quarter of 2022 compared to the second quarter of 2022.
tgt: The unemployment rate according to the expanded definition of unemployment also decreased by 1,0 percentage point to 43,1% in the third quarter of 2022 compared to the second quarter of 2022.

src: While this increase may be viewed as a drop in the ocean, it does show that the strategies to grow employment are starting to yield positive results.
tgt: While this increase may be viewed as a drop in the ocean, it does show that the strategies to grow employment are starting to yield positive results.

src: The largest jobs gain were recorded in manufacturing (123 000), followed by trade (82 000), construction (46 000), transport (33 000), and community and social services (27 000).
tgt: The largest jobs gain were recorded in manufacturing (123 000), followed by trade (82 000), construction (46 000), transport (33 000), and community and social services (27 000).

src: Cabinet called on South Africans to continue to rally behind the country’s Economic Reconstruction and Recovery Plan (ERRP) to ensure that as a country we keep the momentum of growing the economy and creating much-needed jobs.
tgt: Cabinet called on South Africans to continue to rally behind the country’s Economic Reconstruction and Recovery Plan (ERRP) to ensure that as a country we keep the momentum of growing the economy and creating much-needed jobs.

src: Cabinet acknowledges that the country has a long way to go and more work needs to be done to address the challenge of unemployment in the country.
tgt: Cabinet acknowledges that the country has a long way to go and more work needs to be done to address the challenge of unemployment in the country.

src: State Visit to the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland (UK).
tgt: State Visit to the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland (UK).

src: Cabinet welcomed the historic Presidential State Visit to the UK that took place from 22 to 23 November 2022.
tgt: Cabinet welcomed the historic Presidential State Visit to the UK that took place from 22 to 23 November 2022.

src: His Excellency President Cyril Ramaphosa became the first Head of State to be hosted by the British monarch, His Majesty King Charles III, since his accession to the throne in September 2022.
tgt: His Excellency President Cyril Ramaphosa became the first Head of State to be hosted by the British monarch, His Majesty King Charles III, since his accession to the throne in September 2022.

src: A Royal State Visit is the highest honour bestowed on a country by the UK to further promote bilateral relations and it also symbolises the importance the UK ascribes to its relations with a particular country.
tgt: A Royal State Visit is the highest honour bestowed on a country by the UK to further promote bilateral relations and it also symbolises the importance the UK ascribes to its relations with a particular country.

src: The Presidential State Visit, which marked a continuation of the strong bilateral ties between South Africa and the UK, resulted in the launch of the next phase of the UK-South Africa Infrastructure Partnership.
tgt: The Presidential State Visit, which marked a continuation of the strong bilateral ties between South Africa and the UK, resulted in the launch of the next phase of the UK-South Africa Infrastructure Partnership.

src: The partnership supports South Africa’s economic growth through major infrastructure developments and offers increased access to UK companies in projects worth up to £5.37 billion over the next three years.
tgt: The partnership supports South Africa’s economic growth through major infrastructure developments and offers increased access to UK companies in projects worth up to £5.37 billion over the next three years.

src: The visit focused on upgrading trade and investment levels between the two countries, and also on creating more opportunities in British markets for South African goods and commodities.
tgt: The visit focused on upgrading trade and investment levels between the two countries, and also on creating more opportunities in British markets for South African goods and commodities.

src: During the UK-SA Business Forum, numerous business opportunities on offer were profiled to UK investors who pledged their continued engagement with South Africa.
tgt: During the UK-SA Business Forum, numerous business opportunities on offer were profiled to UK investors who pledged their continued engagement with South Africa.

src: South Africa and the UK also signed Memorandums of Understanding on Cooperation in Science and Innovation as well as Health Cooperation that would focus on vaccine manufacturing, genome sequencing and climate change.
tgt: South Africa and the UK also signed Memorandums of Understanding on Cooperation in Science and Innovation as well as Health Cooperation that would focus on vaccine manufacturing, genome sequencing and climate change.

src: Other outcomes from the visit included securing collaboration on infrastructure, clean technology and renewable energy sources.
tgt: Other outcomes from the visit included securing collaboration on infrastructure, clean technology and renewable energy sources.

src: These opportunities hold the potential to unlock domestic trade, investment and boost job creation.
tgt: These opportunities hold the potential to unlock domestic trade, investment and boost job creation.

src: Tshwane Automotive Special Economic Zone (TASEZ).
tgt: Tshwane Automotive Special Economic Zone (TASEZ).

src: Cabinet welcomed the production of the next generation Ford Ranger by Ford Motor Company of South Africa (FMCSA), which saw a capital investment of R.8 billion.
tgt: Cabinet welcomed the production of the next generation Ford Ranger by Ford Motor Company of South Africa (FMCSA), which saw a capital investment of R.8 billion.

src: This resulted in all 10 auto component manufacturing companies located in the TASEZ officially entering into full operation.
tgt: This resulted in all 10 auto component manufacturing companies located in the TASEZ officially entering into full operation.

src: The investment by the component manufacturers amounted to R.62 billion and created 1 259 permanent jobs benefiting youth (76%) and women (32%).
tgt: The investment by the component manufacturers amounted to R.62 billion and created 1 259 permanent jobs benefiting youth (76%) and women (32%).

src: TASEZ was established as a special-purpose vehicle production zone with a mandate to create employment opportunities and promote economic participation for small, medium and micro enterprises in the region.
tgt: TASEZ was established as a special-purpose vehicle production zone with a mandate to create employment opportunities and promote economic participation for small, medium and micro enterprises in the region.

src: Its first phase of development was aimed at creating additional infrastructure and capacity within the FMCSA supply chain to support South Africa to be one of the only three hubs in the world to produce the next-generation Ford Ranger.
tgt: Its first phase of development was aimed at creating additional infrastructure and capacity within the FMCSA supply chain to support South Africa to be one of the only three hubs in the world to produce the next-generation Ford Ranger.

src: National Digital and Future Skills Conference.
tgt: National Digital and Future Skills Conference.

src: Cabinet welcomed the outcomes of the National Digital and Future Skills Conference held in Umhlanga, KwaZulu-Natal from 22 to 23 November 2022, to strengthen our nation’s advances in the area of digital and future skills in South Africa.
tgt: Cabinet welcomed the outcomes of the National Digital and Future Skills Conference held in Umhlanga, KwaZulu-Natal from 22 to 23 November 2022, to strengthen our nation’s advances in the area of digital and future skills in South Africa.

src: Hosted by the Department of Communications and Digital Technologies (DCDT) in partnership with the Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ), the conference aimed to, among others, strengthen partnerships in the area of digital and future skills in South Africa, create and stimulate interest in digital and future skills, and explore digital skills training opportunities available for youth presented by the Fourth Industrial Revolution.
tgt: Hosted by the Department of Communications and Digital Technologies (DCDT) in partnership with the Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ), the conference aimed to, among others, strengthen partnerships in the area of digital and future skills in South Africa, create and stimulate interest in digital and future skills, and explore digital skills training opportunities available for youth presented by the Fourth Industrial Revolution.

src: The conference forged partnerships between government, business, civil society, international development organisations and youth organisations to take our nation forward into the digital era.
tgt: The conference forged partnerships between government, business, civil society, international development organisations and youth organisations to take our nation forward into the digital era.

src: New Thuthuzela Care Centre in Limpopo.
tgt: New Thuthuzela Care Centre in Limpopo.

src: Cabinet welcomed the opening of the Thuthuzela Care Centre in the Dilokong Hospital at Dilokong Village in Driekop, Limpopo on Tuesday, 22 November 2022.
tgt: Cabinet welcomed the opening of the Thuthuzela Care Centre in the Dilokong Hospital at Dilokong Village in Driekop, Limpopo on Tuesday, 22 November 2022.

src: The one-stop facility offers services in support of victims of gender-based violence and femicide (GBVF) and sexual crimes.
tgt: The one-stop facility offers services in support of victims of gender-based violence and femicide (GBVF) and sexual crimes.

src: The centre is the 62nd to be opened across the country and fulfils the commitment government made at the 2018 Presidential Summit Against GBVF to build more of such centres.
tgt: The centre is the 62nd to be opened across the country and fulfils the commitment government made at the 2018 Presidential Summit Against GBVF to build more of such centres.

src: Auditor-General’s (AG) 2021/22 Consolidated General Report.
tgt: Auditor-General’s (AG) 2021/22 Consolidated General Report.

src: Cabinet welcomed the 2021/22 Public Finance Management Act audit outcomes of the national and provincial government, which were released by AG Tsakani Maluleke on Wednesday, 23 November 2022 under the theme: “A culture of accountability will improve service delivery”.
tgt: Cabinet welcomed the 2021/22 Public Finance Management Act audit outcomes of the national and provincial government, which were released by AG Tsakani Maluleke on Wednesday, 23 November 2022 under the theme: “A culture of accountability will improve service delivery”.

src: Cabinet noted the gradual upward trend in the audit outcomes of national and provincial government but expressed concern that key service delivery portfolios continued to receive poor outcomes.
tgt: Cabinet noted the gradual upward trend in the audit outcomes of national and provincial government but expressed concern that key service delivery portfolios continued to receive poor outcomes.

src: Based on the completed audits of 160 departments, 47 departments had improved and 12 had regressed.
tgt: Based on the completed audits of 160 departments, 47 departments had improved and 12 had regressed.

src: Similarly, of the 238 public entities with completed audits, 67 had improved and 34 had regressed.
tgt: Similarly, of the 238 public entities with completed audits, 67 had improved and 34 had regressed.

src: Cabinet affirmed government’s commitment to taking corrective measures to address the root causes that lead to poor audit outcomes and remove weaknesses to achieve clean audits.
tgt: Cabinet affirmed government’s commitment to taking corrective measures to address the root causes that lead to poor audit outcomes and remove weaknesses to achieve clean audits.

src: Safer Festive Season campaign.
tgt: Safer Festive Season campaign.

src: Government recently launched the 2022 Safer Festive Season campaign under the theme: “More boots on the ground towards enhanced police visibility.”.
tgt: Government recently launched the 2022 Safer Festive Season campaign under the theme: “More boots on the ground towards enhanced police visibility.”.

src: To ensure the well-being and safety of all residents and tourists in our country during the festive season and beyond, heightened police visibility will include intensified and integrated crime-prevention and crime-combating operations by the South African Police Service and other law-enforcement agencies.
tgt: To ensure the well-being and safety of all residents and tourists in our country during the festive season and beyond, heightened police visibility will include intensified and integrated crime-prevention and crime-combating operations by the South African Police Service and other law-enforcement agencies.

src: Cabinet calls on all people to work with law-enforcement authorities to keep our communities safe.
tgt: Cabinet calls on all people to work with law-enforcement authorities to keep our communities safe.

src: As traffic volumes on our national roads increase, all road users are urged to be vigilant, and to obey traffic rules and regulations such as speed limits.
tgt: As traffic volumes on our national roads increase, all road users are urged to be vigilant, and to obey traffic rules and regulations such as speed limits.

src: Do not drive while under the influence of alcohol, always wear your seatbelt, keep a safe following distance and stop at a safe place to rest after at least every three hours of driving.
tgt: Do not drive while under the influence of alcohol, always wear your seatbelt, keep a safe following distance and stop at a safe place to rest after at least every three hours of driving.

src: Be courteous to other road users so that we can all reach our destinations safely.
tgt: Be courteous to other road users so that we can all reach our destinations safely.

src: Cabinet urges everyone to take extra care this festive season to ensure their own safety and that of others, especially children, who must be supervised at all times.
tgt: Cabinet urges everyone to take extra care this festive season to ensure their own safety and that of others, especially children, who must be supervised at all times.

src: By exercising extreme care and responsible behaviour, we can guarantee an enjoyable time of celebration with family and friends.
tgt: By exercising extreme care and responsible behaviour, we can guarantee an enjoyable time of celebration with family and friends.

src: South Africa Green Hydrogen Summit (SAGHS).
tgt: South Africa Green Hydrogen Summit (SAGHS).

src: Cabinet welcomed the successful conclusion of the country’s inaugural SAGHS 2022 held in Cape Town from 28 to 30 November 2022, which showcased our nation’s offerings as a world-class green hydrogen production hub.
tgt: Cabinet welcomed the successful conclusion of the country’s inaugural SAGHS 2022 held in Cape Town from 28 to 30 November 2022, which showcased our nation’s offerings as a world-class green hydrogen production hub.

src: In creating the environment for the green hydrogen sector to flourish, government has developed a Hydrogen SA Strategy that taps into our nation’s endowment of renewable energy and platinum, a catalyst in the hydrogen electrolysis process, to position South Africa as a global leader in this new market.
tgt: In creating the environment for the green hydrogen sector to flourish, government has developed a Hydrogen SA Strategy that taps into our nation’s endowment of renewable energy and platinum, a catalyst in the hydrogen electrolysis process, to position South Africa as a global leader in this new market.

src: The green hydrogen economy is part of our work under the ERRP to explore new sources of economic growth that have the potential to revolutionise our economy and create new jobs.
tgt: The green hydrogen economy is part of our work under the ERRP to explore new sources of economic growth that have the potential to revolutionise our economy and create new jobs.

src: Launch of the Artificial Intelligence (AI) Institute of South Africa.
tgt: Launch of the Artificial Intelligence (AI) Institute of South Africa.

src: Cabinet welcomed the collaboration between the DCDT, Tshwane University of Technology and the University of Johannesburg that resulted in the launch of the AI Institute of South at the Johannesburg Business School on Wednesday, 30 November 2022.
tgt: Cabinet welcomed the collaboration between the DCDT, Tshwane University of Technology and the University of Johannesburg that resulted in the launch of the AI Institute of South at the Johannesburg Business School on Wednesday, 30 November 2022.

src: The first-of-its-kind institute ushers a new era in South Africa’s digital transformation efforts.
tgt: The first-of-its-kind institute ushers a new era in South Africa’s digital transformation efforts.

src: It will stimulate economic growth, address unemployment and create a positive social impact.
tgt: It will stimulate economic growth, address unemployment and create a positive social impact.

src: The AI Institute will expand the teaching of robotics and coding currently being offered in public schools.
tgt: The AI Institute will expand the teaching of robotics and coding currently being offered in public schools.

src: The institute is designed to ensure that government academia and industry work together in a unique partnership to apply their collective knowledge, expertise and experience to implement coordinated solutions to some of South Africa and Africa’s most critical and long-standing challenges, and to take the continent forward.
tgt: The institute is designed to ensure that government academia and industry work together in a unique partnership to apply their collective knowledge, expertise and experience to implement coordinated solutions to some of South Africa and Africa’s most critical and long-standing challenges, and to take the continent forward.

src: Government’s focus on digital skills includes creating platforms to support and promote the ability of youth, and small and medium enterprises, in particular start-ups, to develop digital content.
tgt: Government’s focus on digital skills includes creating platforms to support and promote the ability of youth, and small and medium enterprises, in particular start-ups, to develop digital content.

src: Cabinet decisions.
tgt: Cabinet decisions.

src: Research Report on the economic costs of disability for children with disabilities and persons with physical disabilities in South Africa.
tgt: Research Report on the economic costs of disability for children with disabilities and persons with physical disabilities in South Africa.

src: Cabinet considered and approved the Research Report that was commissioned by the Department for Women, Youth and Persons with Disabilities (DWYPD), in partnership with the United Nations (UN) Development Programme (UNDP).
tgt: Cabinet considered and approved the Research Report that was commissioned by the Department for Women, Youth and Persons with Disabilities (DWYPD), in partnership with the United Nations (UN) Development Programme (UNDP).

src: The research provides information on disability-related costs on households with children with disabilities and adults with physical disabilities.
tgt: The research provides information on disability-related costs on households with children with disabilities and adults with physical disabilities.

src: The research insights provide evidence of cost estimates for, among others, the determination of social-security benefits subsidisation of services for persons with disabilities.
tgt: The research insights provide evidence of cost estimates for, among others, the determination of social-security benefits subsidisation of services for persons with disabilities.

src: This report complements the study also done by the UNDP between 2013 and 2015 on elements of the financial and economic costs of disability households in South Africa.
tgt: This report complements the study also done by the UNDP between 2013 and 2015 on elements of the financial and economic costs of disability households in South Africa.

src: The report will be published after it has been gazetted.
tgt: The report will be published after it has been gazetted.

src: Rapid Evaluation of the implementation of government policy on preferential public procurement towards women, youth and persons with disabilities.
tgt: Rapid Evaluation of the implementation of government policy on preferential public procurement towards women, youth and persons with disabilities.

src: Cabinet received an evaluation report that assessed the compliance rate by national and provincial departments on the preferential procurement application on businesses owned by women, youth and persons with disabilities.
tgt: Cabinet received an evaluation report that assessed the compliance rate by national and provincial departments on the preferential procurement application on businesses owned by women, youth and persons with disabilities.

src: The evaluation covered the period from 2018 to 2021.
tgt: The evaluation covered the period from 2018 to 2021.

src: Data was collected from National Treasury’s Central Supplier Database (CSD) and respondents from departments to the questionnaires sent to them.
tgt: Data was collected from National Treasury’s Central Supplier Database (CSD) and respondents from departments to the questionnaires sent to them.

src: The data did not, however, capture information from all the departments, but was sufficient enough to guide Cabinet on areas that need strengthening to ensure full compliance.
tgt: The data did not, however, capture information from all the departments, but was sufficient enough to guide Cabinet on areas that need strengthening to ensure full compliance.

src: Cabinet approved all the intervention recommendations that will ensure government complies with the 40% procurement to women in particular.
tgt: Cabinet approved all the intervention recommendations that will ensure government complies with the 40% procurement to women in particular.

src: Some of the recommendations include the enhancement of the CSD software, and the training and awareness raising of accounting officers and Supply Chain Management practitioners in departments.
tgt: Some of the recommendations include the enhancement of the CSD software, and the training and awareness raising of accounting officers and Supply Chain Management practitioners in departments.

src: The full report will be posted on the DWYPD’s website: WEBTOKEScience, Technology and Innovation (STI) Decadal Plan 2022.
tgt: The full report will be posted on the DWYPD’s website: WEBTOKEScience, Technology and Innovation (STI) Decadal Plan 2022.

src: Cabinet approved the 2022 STI Decadal Plan, which serves as an implementation guide of the 2019 White Paper on STCabinet approved the draft plan in March 2021 and has since been enriched through further consultation with relevant stakeholders.
tgt: Cabinet approved the 2022 STI Decadal Plan, which serves as an implementation guide of the 2019 White Paper on STCabinet approved the draft plan in March 2021 and has since been enriched through further consultation with relevant stakeholders.

src: The plan has five thematic focus areas: (1) modernisation of agricultural, manufacturing and mining sectors (2) exploitation of new sources of growth, particularly the digital and circular economy (3) large research and innovation programmes in the areas of health and energy (4) utilising STI to support a capable state and (5) addressing three societal grand challenges, namely climate change and environmental sustainability, the future of education, skills development and work, and the future of society.
tgt: The plan has five thematic focus areas: (1) modernisation of agricultural, manufacturing and mining sectors (2) exploitation of new sources of growth, particularly the digital and circular economy (3) large research and innovation programmes in the areas of health and energy (4) utilising STI to support a capable state and (5) addressing three societal grand challenges, namely climate change and environmental sustainability, the future of education, skills development and work, and the future of society.

src: The first Decadal Plan for 2008-2018, together with the 2002 National Research and Development Strategy, served as the basis of the current Decadal Plan.
tgt: The first Decadal Plan for 2008-2018, together with the 2002 National Research and Development Strategy, served as the basis of the current Decadal Plan.

src: These plans advance the government’s approach to innovation in South Africa.
tgt: These plans advance the government’s approach to innovation in South Africa.

src: The document will be made public through the Department of Science and Innovation’s (DSI) website: WEBTOKENational Strategy and Risk Assessment on Anti-Money Laundering, Counter Financing of Terrorism and Counter Financing of Proliferation (AML/CFT/CPF).
tgt: The document will be made public through the Department of Science and Innovation’s (DSI) website: WEBTOKENational Strategy and Risk Assessment on Anti-Money Laundering, Counter Financing of Terrorism and Counter Financing of Proliferation (AML/CFT/CPF).

src: Cabinet approved the country’s National Strategy on AML/CFT/CPF, together with the National Risk Assessment.
tgt: Cabinet approved the country’s National Strategy on AML/CFT/CPF, together with the National Risk Assessment.

src: The strategy was developed as a response to the risk assessment prepared by all the relevant security and finance agencies.
tgt: The strategy was developed as a response to the risk assessment prepared by all the relevant security and finance agencies.

src: The operationalisation of this strategy – which provides three high-level goals with 13 strategic objectives – will involve law-enforcement agencies, intelligence agencies, financial and non-financial institutions, and private-sector representatives, among others.
tgt: The operationalisation of this strategy – which provides three high-level goals with 13 strategic objectives – will involve law-enforcement agencies, intelligence agencies, financial and non-financial institutions, and private-sector representatives, among others.

src: The implementation of the strategy will ensure the country strengthens its financial systems to support economic growth interventions by reducing levels of finance-related crimes.
tgt: The implementation of the strategy will ensure the country strengthens its financial systems to support economic growth interventions by reducing levels of finance-related crimes.

src: The strategy also responds to some of the 40 recommendations made after South Africa was assessed by the Financial Action Task Force, an intergovernmental policymaking body that strives to combat terrorist financing and money laundering globally.
tgt: The strategy also responds to some of the 40 recommendations made after South Africa was assessed by the Financial Action Task Force, an intergovernmental policymaking body that strives to combat terrorist financing and money laundering globally.

src: The summarised two reports will be published on National Treasury’s website: WEBTOKEGreen Hydrogen Commercialisation Strategy (GHCS).
tgt: The summarised two reports will be published on National Treasury’s website: WEBTOKEGreen Hydrogen Commercialisation Strategy (GHCS).

src: Cabinet approved the publication of the GHCS for public comments.
tgt: Cabinet approved the publication of the GHCS for public comments.

src: The strategy is aimed at ensuring that the country takes full advantage of the opportunities provided by green industrialisation.
tgt: The strategy is aimed at ensuring that the country takes full advantage of the opportunities provided by green industrialisation.

src: The GHCS will ensure South Africa becomes a major producer and exporter of green hydrogen.
tgt: The GHCS will ensure South Africa becomes a major producer and exporter of green hydrogen.

src: It contributes towards economic growth and supports the country’s just transition interventions towards the reduction of carbon emissions.
tgt: It contributes towards economic growth and supports the country’s just transition interventions towards the reduction of carbon emissions.

src: South Africa already has the Hydrogen Strategy and the Hydrogen Society Roadmap adopted by Cabinet in 2021.
tgt: South Africa already has the Hydrogen Strategy and the Hydrogen Society Roadmap adopted by Cabinet in 2021.

src: The rapidly growing green hydrogen market presents huge opportunities for South Africa.
tgt: The rapidly growing green hydrogen market presents huge opportunities for South Africa.

src: State Litigation Strategy for 2021 – 2026.
tgt: State Litigation Strategy for 2021 – 2026.

src: Cabinet approved the State Litigation Strategy for 2021 – 2026.
tgt: Cabinet approved the State Litigation Strategy for 2021 – 2026.

src: The strategy seeks to drive the transformation of the legal profession in a systematic manner.
tgt: The strategy seeks to drive the transformation of the legal profession in a systematic manner.

src: It guides on how the State will distribute legal work to legal practitioners manage the costs of the litigation guides the management of stakeholders provides for the maximisation of the use of technology and systems.
tgt: It guides on how the State will distribute legal work to legal practitioners manage the costs of the litigation guides the management of stakeholders provides for the maximisation of the use of technology and systems.

src: The strategy also addresses the development of human capacity management and development.
tgt: The strategy also addresses the development of human capacity management and development.

src: It will be applicable to litigation services of the State from all spheres of government.
tgt: It will be applicable to litigation services of the State from all spheres of government.

src: Cabinet also approved the two additional policies to support the implementation of this strategy.
tgt: Cabinet also approved the two additional policies to support the implementation of this strategy.

src: The Briefing and Outsourcing of State Legal work Policy will introduce an element of fairness and drive the transformational allocation of litigation services that cannot be performed internally.
tgt: The Briefing and Outsourcing of State Legal work Policy will introduce an element of fairness and drive the transformational allocation of litigation services that cannot be performed internally.

src: The Initiating, Defending and Opposing of Matters Policy will provide clarity on processes to be followed by client departments and the Office of Solicitor-General.
tgt: The Initiating, Defending and Opposing of Matters Policy will provide clarity on processes to be followed by client departments and the Office of Solicitor-General.

src: The two policies – together with the other policies that were approved by Cabinet in November 2021 and the Legal Sector Code – will support the implementation of this strategy.
tgt: The two policies – together with the other policies that were approved by Cabinet in November 2021 and the Legal Sector Code – will support the implementation of this strategy.

src: These documents will ensure a meaningful transformational intervention in the legal sector and also ensure the economies of scale in litigation matters that involve the State.
tgt: These documents will ensure a meaningful transformational intervention in the legal sector and also ensure the economies of scale in litigation matters that involve the State.

src: Management of State Litigation Contingent Liability Policy.
tgt: Management of State Litigation Contingent Liability Policy.

src: Cabinet approved the State Litigation Contingent Liability Policy, which provides mechanisms to manage state litigation contingent liability.
tgt: Cabinet approved the State Litigation Contingent Liability Policy, which provides mechanisms to manage state litigation contingent liability.

src: It provides for the creation of a central database and the reporting mechanism on the following-up of the cases in this database.
tgt: It provides for the creation of a central database and the reporting mechanism on the following-up of the cases in this database.

src: The policy provides for the mechanism to close dormant case files that were resulting in unreliable contingent liability figures in respect of accountability.
tgt: The policy provides for the mechanism to close dormant case files that were resulting in unreliable contingent liability figures in respect of accountability.

src: Bills.
tgt: Bills.

src: National Sport and Recreation Amendment Bill of 2022.
tgt: National Sport and Recreation Amendment Bill of 2022.

src: Cabinet approved the submission of the National Sport and Recreation Amendment Bill of 2022 to Parliament for further processing.
tgt: Cabinet approved the submission of the National Sport and Recreation Amendment Bill of 2022 to Parliament for further processing.

src: The Bill amends the National Sport and Recreation Act, of 1998 (Act 110 of 1998).
tgt: The Bill amends the National Sport and Recreation Act, of 1998 (Act 110 of 1998).

src: The Bill has already been published for public consultation.
tgt: The Bill has already been published for public consultation.

src: The Bill also amends certain definitions and amongst other interventions, it proposes the establishment of the Sports Arbitration Tribunal to resolve disputes between sport or recreation bodies.
tgt: The Bill also amends certain definitions and amongst other interventions, it proposes the establishment of the Sports Arbitration Tribunal to resolve disputes between sport or recreation bodies.

src: It outlines procedures to be followed for bidding for international events.
tgt: It outlines procedures to be followed for bidding for international events.

src: The proposed amendments also empower the Minister of Sport, Arts and Culture to make regulations for vulnerable groups to participate in sport and be protected from any form of sexual abuse or exploitation.
tgt: The proposed amendments also empower the Minister of Sport, Arts and Culture to make regulations for vulnerable groups to participate in sport and be protected from any form of sexual abuse or exploitation.

src: South African Broadcasting Corporation (SABC) Bill of 2022.
tgt: South African Broadcasting Corporation (SABC) Bill of 2022.

src: Cabinet approved the submission to Parliament of the SABC Bill of 2022 for processing.
tgt: Cabinet approved the submission to Parliament of the SABC Bill of 2022 for processing.

src: The Bill was published for public comment in June 2021.
tgt: The Bill was published for public comment in June 2021.

src: Once the Bill is passed into law by Parliament, the current Broadcasting Act, 1999 (Act 4 of 1999) will be repealed.
tgt: Once the Bill is passed into law by Parliament, the current Broadcasting Act, 1999 (Act 4 of 1999) will be repealed.

src: The Bill amongst others proposes reducing the size of non-executive Board members from 12 to 11 and the executive members from three to two.
tgt: The Bill amongst others proposes reducing the size of non-executive Board members from 12 to 11 and the executive members from three to two.

src: It revised the governance structure and funding model of the SABRepeal of the Transkeian Penal Code Bill of 2022.
tgt: It revised the governance structure and funding model of the SABRepeal of the Transkeian Penal Code Bill of 2022.

src: Cabinet approved the submission to Parliament of the Repeal of the Transkeian Penal Code Bill of 2022 for further processing.
tgt: Cabinet approved the submission to Parliament of the Repeal of the Transkeian Penal Code Bill of 2022 for further processing.

src: The Bill repeals the Transkeian Penal Code, 1983 (Act 9 of 1983) which codified criminal law in the former Transkei (now Eastern Cape).
tgt: The Bill repeals the Transkeian Penal Code, 1983 (Act 9 of 1983) which codified criminal law in the former Transkei (now Eastern Cape).

src: The proposed Bill extends the current application of common laws to the former Republic of Transkei in line with our unitary system of the country’s judicial system.
tgt: The proposed Bill extends the current application of common laws to the former Republic of Transkei in line with our unitary system of the country’s judicial system.

src: The Transkeian Penal Code is in conflict with the current common criminal law that regulates the same subject matter in different parts of the country.
tgt: The Transkeian Penal Code is in conflict with the current common criminal law that regulates the same subject matter in different parts of the country.

src: This repeal will remove the continued existence of apartheid-era legislation in the areas that were formerly known as the Republic of Transkei and provide the transitional arrangements on matters dealt with by this code.
tgt: This repeal will remove the continued existence of apartheid-era legislation in the areas that were formerly known as the Republic of Transkei and provide the transitional arrangements on matters dealt with by this code.

src: Constitution Eighteenth Amendment Bill of 2022.
tgt: Constitution Eighteenth Amendment Bill of 2022.

src: Cabinet approved the submission of the Constitution Eighteenth Amendment Bill of 2022 to Parliament for further processing.
tgt: Cabinet approved the submission of the Constitution Eighteenth Amendment Bill of 2022 to Parliament for further processing.

src: The Bill amends Section 6 of the Constitution of the Republic of South Africa of 1996 to recognise South African Sign Language as one of the official languages.
tgt: The Bill amends Section 6 of the Constitution of the Republic of South Africa of 1996 to recognise South African Sign Language as one of the official languages.

src: In May 2022, Cabinet approved the publication and giving of notice to this Bill, which together with the notice were subsequently gazetted in July Criminal Law (Sexual Offences and Related Matters) Amendment Bill of 2022.
tgt: In May 2022, Cabinet approved the publication and giving of notice to this Bill, which together with the notice were subsequently gazetted in July Criminal Law (Sexual Offences and Related Matters) Amendment Bill of 2022.

src: Cabinet approved the publishing of this Bill for public comments.
tgt: Cabinet approved the publishing of this Bill for public comments.

src: It repeals the Sexual Offences Act (previously Immorality Act), 1957 (Act 23 of 1957).
tgt: It repeals the Sexual Offences Act (previously Immorality Act), 1957 (Act 23 of 1957).

src: It also repeals Section 11 of the Criminal Law (Sexual Offenses and Related Matters) Amendment Act, 2007 (Act 32 of 2007) to decriminalise the sale and purchase of adult sexual services.
tgt: It also repeals Section 11 of the Criminal Law (Sexual Offenses and Related Matters) Amendment Act, 2007 (Act 32 of 2007) to decriminalise the sale and purchase of adult sexual services.

src: The proposals of this Bill respond to the list of interventions proposed in Pillar 3 (Protection, Safety and Justice) of the National Strategic Plan on GBVF, which enjoins the criminal justice system to provide protection, safety and justice for survivors of GBVF, and to effectively hold perpetrators accountable for their actions.
tgt: The proposals of this Bill respond to the list of interventions proposed in Pillar 3 (Protection, Safety and Justice) of the National Strategic Plan on GBVF, which enjoins the criminal justice system to provide protection, safety and justice for survivors of GBVF, and to effectively hold perpetrators accountable for their actions.

src: Once passed into law, it will amongst others protect sex workers against abuse and exploitation.
tgt: Once passed into law, it will amongst others protect sex workers against abuse and exploitation.

src: South African Post Office (SAPO) Amendment Bill Cabinet approved the submission of the SAPO Amendment Bill to Parliament for further processing.
tgt: South African Post Office (SAPO) Amendment Bill Cabinet approved the submission of the SAPO Amendment Bill to Parliament for further processing.

src: The Bill, which was approved for public consultation early this year, amends the SAPO Act, 2011 (Act 22 of 2011).
tgt: The Bill, which was approved for public consultation early this year, amends the SAPO Act, 2011 (Act 22 of 2011).

src: The proposed amendments seek to enable the SAPO to adapt to the technological developments in the courier-service space and expand its mandate.
tgt: The proposed amendments seek to enable the SAPO to adapt to the technological developments in the courier-service space and expand its mandate.

src: The changes are in line with the National Integrated Information and Communications Technology Policy White Paper of 2016.Upcoming events.
tgt: The changes are in line with the National Integrated Information and Communications Technology Policy White Paper of 2016.Upcoming events.

src: 2022 World Science Forum (WSF).
tgt: 2022 World Science Forum (WSF).

src: South Africa will, through the DSI, host the WSF at the Cape Town International Convention Centre Cape from 6 to 9 December 2022 under the theme: “Science for Social Justice”.
tgt: South Africa will, through the DSI, host the WSF at the Cape Town International Convention Centre Cape from 6 to 9 December 2022 under the theme: “Science for Social Justice”.

src: The forum is one of the leading global platforms that encourage dialogue on the role science should play in society.
tgt: The forum is one of the leading global platforms that encourage dialogue on the role science should play in society.

src: It is an initiative of global science organisations that also include the UN Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organisation.
tgt: It is an initiative of global science organisations that also include the UN Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organisation.

src: Renowned thought leaders will be debating various topics that include science for human dignity science for climate justice, science diplomacy for multilateralism, and science for Africa and the world.
tgt: Renowned thought leaders will be debating various topics that include science for human dignity science for climate justice, science diplomacy for multilateralism, and science for Africa and the world.

src: A number of side and satellite events will take place concurrently, and some of them will be hosted by the General Assembly of the African Academy of Sciences, a Pan-African organisation whose vision is to transform lives on the African continent through science.
tgt: A number of side and satellite events will take place concurrently, and some of them will be hosted by the General Assembly of the African Academy of Sciences, a Pan-African organisation whose vision is to transform lives on the African continent through science.

src: World AIDS Day.
tgt: World AIDS Day.

src: South Africa will join the world in observing and participating in activities to mark the annual World AIDS Day on 1 December 2022 under the theme: “Equalise and Integrate to End AIDS”.
tgt: South Africa will join the world in observing and participating in activities to mark the annual World AIDS Day on 1 December 2022 under the theme: “Equalise and Integrate to End AIDS”.

src: The national commemoration event that will be held at the Dr Petrus Molemela Stadium in Bloemfontein in the Free State will be used to remind everyone to be responsible by getting to know their health status so as to make informed life decisions.
tgt: The national commemoration event that will be held at the Dr Petrus Molemela Stadium in Bloemfontein in the Free State will be used to remind everyone to be responsible by getting to know their health status so as to make informed life decisions.

src: The commemoration comes as South Africa prepares to begin piloting the injectable pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) early next year, which is recommended by the World Health Organisation.
tgt: The commemoration comes as South Africa prepares to begin piloting the injectable pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) early next year, which is recommended by the World Health Organisation.

src: The PrEP injection, to be taken every other month, could prevent as many as 52 000 new HIV infections.
tgt: The PrEP injection, to be taken every other month, could prevent as many as 52 000 new HIV infections.

src: Reconciliation Day On Friday, 16 December 2022, the nation will celebrate Reconciliation Day to reaffirm our commitment to unity and nation-building.
tgt: Reconciliation Day On Friday, 16 December 2022, the nation will celebrate Reconciliation Day to reaffirm our commitment to unity and nation-building.

src: Each year we have an opportunity to reach out to one another to deal with our past, reconcile and build a new nation going forward.
tgt: Each year we have an opportunity to reach out to one another to deal with our past, reconcile and build a new nation going forward.

src: Our journey since the advent of freedom and democracy in 1994 has decisively shown that we are stronger as a nation when we are united.
tgt: Our journey since the advent of freedom and democracy in 1994 has decisively shown that we are stronger as a nation when we are united.

src: Our goal as South Africans should be to promote inclusive nation-building and social cohesion.
tgt: Our goal as South Africans should be to promote inclusive nation-building and social cohesion.

src: Together we can build a better tomorrow for all by striving to ensure a nation that encourages dialogue, fosters social cohesion, embraces nation-building and celebrates its diverse culture.
tgt: Together we can build a better tomorrow for all by striving to ensure a nation that encourages dialogue, fosters social cohesion, embraces nation-building and celebrates its diverse culture.

src: Cabinet calls on everyone to work together as a nation, and harness our collective strengths to build a united and prosperous South Africa.
tgt: Cabinet calls on everyone to work together as a nation, and harness our collective strengths to build a united and prosperous South Africa.

src: National Active Ageing Programme.
tgt: National Active Ageing Programme.

src: The Department of Social Development will host the National Active Ageing Programme in Germiston, Gauteng from 5 to 7 December 2022.
tgt: The Department of Social Development will host the National Active Ageing Programme in Germiston, Gauteng from 5 to 7 December 2022.

src: The programme brings all nine provinces together and is aimed at promoting the independent and healthy lifestyle of older persons to ensure that they actively participate in their communities.
tgt: The programme brings all nine provinces together and is aimed at promoting the independent and healthy lifestyle of older persons to ensure that they actively participate in their communities.

src: The National Active Ageing Programme will open with a national dialogue to allow older persons to engage on pertinent matters affecting them.
tgt: The National Active Ageing Programme will open with a national dialogue to allow older persons to engage on pertinent matters affecting them.

src: This will be followed by the Golden Games where older persons will showcase their athletic abilities.
tgt: This will be followed by the Golden Games where older persons will showcase their athletic abilities.

src: The Older Persons Act, 2006 (Act 13 of 2006) emphasises the importance of the protection and promotion of the rights, dignity, status, integrity, safety, security and well-being of older persons.
tgt: The Older Persons Act, 2006 (Act 13 of 2006) emphasises the importance of the protection and promotion of the rights, dignity, status, integrity, safety, security and well-being of older persons.

src: In this regard, Cabinet calls upon all communities to care, respect and support older persons, especially against abuse, ill-treatment, neglect and GBV.
tgt: In this regard, Cabinet calls upon all communities to care, respect and support older persons, especially against abuse, ill-treatment, neglect and GBV.

src: MessagesCongratulations.
tgt: MessagesCongratulations.

src: Cabinet extended its congratulations and well-wishes to:Prize winners of the 2022 SADC Media Awards.
tgt: Cabinet extended its congratulations and well-wishes to:Prize winners of the 2022 SADC Media Awards.

src: Mr Sandile Stevenson Ndlovu from the Sunday Times for first prize in the photographic category, Ms Zinhle Makhosazane Mugabe from SABC for the second prize in the TV category and Ms Melinda Shaw from the Poultry Bulletin Magazine for third prize in the Print category.

tgt: Cabinet extended its condolences to the friends and families of:Mr John Henry Ernstzen (82), a veteran trade unionist and political activist who also served in the Public Service as an advisor to the then Minister of Public Service and Administration, Dr Zola Skweyiya.

src: Kulamaviki letako, tingcoco teticheme titawuniketa lwatiso lolubanti mayelana neLuhlelo Lwekusebenta lwahulumende (i-PoA) yalomnyaka lotako, njengobe Mengameli Ramaphosa akugcamisile ku-SoNSabelomali Savelonkhe lesitawetfulwa ngaLesitsatfu, mhla tinge-22 Indlovana 2023 sitawuniketa lolunye lwatiso mayelana ne-PoIngcungcutsela Yetimayini Evenikati i-Afrika yanga-2023.
tgt: Indaba ya zwa Migodi ya ḽa Afrika ya ṅwaha wa 2023 Khabinethe yo dzhiela nṱha mawanwa a Indaba ya zwa Migodi ya ḽa Afrika ye ya farelwa fhaḽa Sentharani ya zwa Miṱangano ya Dzitshaka ya Cape Town u bva nga ḽa 6 u swika ḽa 9 Luhuhi 2023 nga fhasi ha thero ine ya ri: “U bvukulula Vhubindudzi ha zwa Migodi ya ḽa Afrika: Vhudziki, Tsireledzo na Nḓisedzo”.

src: Ikhabhinethi iyinakile imiphumela yeNgcungcutsela Yetimayini Evenikati i-Afrika lebeyibanjelwe e-International Convention Centre eKapa kusukela mhla ti-6 kuya kumhla ti-9 Indlovana 2023 ngaphasi kwendzikimba letsi:“Kuvula Lutjalomali Lwetimayini Lwase-Afrika: Lutinto, Kuvikeleka kanye Nekuphakela”.
tgt: Indaba ya zwa Migodi ya ḽa Afrika yo kuvhanganya fhethu huthihi zwiimiswa zwi shelaho mulenzhe kha nḓowetshumo iyi u bva kha dzhango ḽa Afrika na ḽifhasi ḽoṱhe nga u angaredza he ya fhedza nga u khwaṱhisa vhuimo hayo ha u vha muṱangano muhulwane wa vhubindudzi kha zwa migodi kha dzhango.

src: Ingcungcutsela Yetimayini Evenikati i-Afrika ihlanganise badlali betimboni labavela kulo lonkhe lelivekati kanye nakumhlaba wonkhe, yaphindze futsi yacinisa indzawo yayo njengengcungcutsela lehamba embili yekutjalwa kwetimali kutetimayini kulelivekati.
tgt: Migodi i khou bvela phanḓa na u shela mulenzhe muhulwane kha zwa mveledziso na vhubveledzanḓowetshumo kha dzhango ḽoṱhe.

src: Budlova betibhamu Ikhabhinethi ivakalise emavi ayo ekulilela umndeni nebangani beliciko le-hip-hop uMnu Kiernan Forbes, lobekadvume ngelekutsi ngu-AKA, kanye nasowatiwako ongumpheki uMnu Tebello Motsoane, labasandza kudutjulwa bashona eThekwini.
tgt: Khakhathi dza zwigidi Khabinethe yo ṱahisa maipfi ayo a ndiliso kha vha muṱa na dzikhonani dza muimbi wa muzika wa hip-hop Vho Kiernan Forbes, vhe vha vha vha tshi ḓivhiwa sa AKA khathihi na mubikimakone Vho Tebello Motsoane, vhe vha thuntshwa vha lovha zwenezwino fhaḽa ḓoroboni ya Durban.

src: Masipala Wendzawo I-Enoch Mgijima (i-EMLM).
tgt: Masipala Wapo wa Enoch Mgijima (EMLM).

src: Indvuna yeTekubusa Ngekubambisana Netendzabuko Nkosazana Dlamini Zuma akanye neNdvuna yeTetimali Enoch Godongwana batise Ikhabhinethi ngetingcoco letisandza kubanjwa nebadlalindzima nalabatsintsekako abakhulu e-EMLNgaMabasa 2022, Ikhabhinethi ikuvumile kungenelela e-EMLM ngekwembandzela weSigaba se-139(7) weMtsetfosisekelo waseRiphabhulikhi yeNingizimu Afrika yanga-1996, lofundvwa kanye neSigaba se-150 seMtsetfo Wetekulawulwa Kwetimali Tamasipala, wanga-2003 (Umtsetfo we-56 wanga-2003).
tgt: Minisṱa vha Tshumisano ya Mavhusele na Mafhungo a zwa Sialala Vho Nkosazana Dlamini Zuma na Minisṱa wa zwa Gwama Vho Enoch Godongwana vho ḓivhadza Khabinethe nga ha miṱangano ya vhukwamani ya zwenezwino ye ya farwa na vhashelamulenzhe vha ndeme khathihi na vhoṱhe vha kwameaho kha mafhungo a fhaḽa EMLNga ṅwedzi wa Lambamai 2022, Khabinethe yo tendela hu tshi shumiswa maga a u dzhenelela fhaḽa EMLM u ya nga Khethekanyo 139(7) ya Ndayotewa ya Riphabuḽiki ya Afrika Tshipembe ya ṅwaha wa 1996, musi i tshi vhalwa khathihi na Khethekanyo 150 ya Mulayo wa Ndangulo ya zwa Masheleni a ha Masipala, wa 2003 (Mulayo 56 wa 2003).

src: Umtsetfosivivinyo Wekusetjentiswa Kwemnyele Lowodvwa(i-OSBP) wanga-2022 Ikhabhinethi ivumile kutsi ummango uphawule ngeMtsetfosivivinyo we-OSBLomtsetfosivivinyo ulandzela kuvunywa kweNchubomgomo ye-OSBP kanye nekucala kwayo kusetjentiswa ngeNdlovulenkhulu 2022.
tgt: Mulayotibe wa Mukaṋo wa Shango wa Mishumo Minzhi (OSBP) wa ṅwaha wa 2022 Khabinethe yo ṱanganedza Mulayotibe wa OSBP hu tshi itelwa uri hu kone u vha na vhupfiwa ha nnyi na nnyi.

src: Uhlose kutsi kube nekuhleleka kahle kuhamba kwebantfu nekuhanjiswa kwemphahla emkhatsini wematubuko ekungena eNingizimu Afrika kanye nasemaveni labomakhelwane bayo.
tgt: Mulayotibe uyu u khou vha hone nga murahu ha u ṱanganedzwa ha mbekanyamaitele ya OSBP khathihi na maano a u thoma u shumiswa hayo nga ṅwadzi wa Ṱhafamuhwe 2022.

src: Umtsetfosivivinyo Wekulawula Nekubhalisa Buwena Wavelonkhe wanga-2022 Ikhabhinethi ivumile kushicilelwa kweMtsetfosivivinyo Wekulawula Nekubhalisa Buwena Wavelonkhe wanga-2022 kute kutsi ummango uphawule ngawo.
tgt: Mulayotibe wa Ṱhalusavhuṋe na Vhuḓiṅwalisi wa Lushaka wa ṅwaha wa 2022 Khabinethe yo ṱanganedza u anḓadzwa ha Mulayotibe wa Ṱhalusavhuṋe na Vhuḓiṅwalisi ha Lushaka wa ṅwaha wa 2022 u itela vhuḓipfi ha tshitshavha.

src: Kokubili i-OSBP yanga 2022 kanye neMtsetfosivivinyo Wekulawula Nekubhalisa Buwena Wavelonkhe wanga-2022 kutawushicilelwa kuwebhusayithi yeLitiko Letasekhaya: WEBTOKEEmalunga emmango akhutsatwa kutsi atfumele kuphawula kwawo lokubhaliwe kulelikheli lelilandzelako: The Director-General of Home Affairs,, Private Bag X114, Pretoria, 0001.
tgt: Vhuvhili hayo, Mulayotibe wa OSBP wa 2022 na Mulayotibe wa Ṱhalusavhuṋe na Vhuḓiṅwalisi wa Lushaka wa 2022 i ḓo anḓadzwa kha webusaithi ya Muhasho wa zwa Muno ine ya vha: WEBTOKEMiraḓo ya tshitshavha i khou ṱuṱuwedzwa uri vha rumele vhupfiwa havho nga u tou ṅwala kha aḓirese i tevhelaho: Mulangi Muhulu wa Muhasho wa zwa Muno, Private Bag X114, Pretoria, 0001.

src: Lucingo: 012 406 4353.Imikhosi Letako.
tgt: Nomboro ya luṱingo: 012 406 4353.Vhuṱambo vhune ha khou ḓa Muṱangano wa Mbumbano ya Afrika (AU).

src: Ingcungcutsela yeBunye be-Afrika (i-AU) Mengameli Cyril Ramaphosa utawuhambela Ingcugcutsela Leyetayelekile ye-36 yeSigungu Sebaholi Bemave naHulumende we-AU letawubanjwa kusukela mhla ti-18 kuya kumhla ti-19 Indlovana 2023 e-Addis Ababa, e-Ethiopia.
tgt: Phresidennde Vho Cyril Ramaphosa vha ḓo dzhenela Dzulo Zwaḽo ḽa vhu36 ḽa Guvhangano ḽa Vharangaphanḓa vha Mashango na Mivhuso ḽa Mbumbano ya Afrika ḽine ḽa ḓo farwa u bva nga ḽa 18 u swika ḽa 19 Luhuhi ngei ḓoroboni ya Addis Ababa, kha ḽa Ethiopia.

src: Lomhlangano we-AU, lotawubanjwa ngaphasi kwengcikitsi letsi “Kuphutfunyiswa Kwekucala Kusebenta Kwe-AfCFTA”, kutawuchutjwa yiNGcungcutsela Leyetayelekile ye-42 yeMkandlu Lomkhulu kusuka mhla ti-15 kuya kumhla ti-16 Indlovana 2023.
tgt: Guvhangano ḽa AU, ḽine ḽa ḓo farwa nga fhasi ha thero ine ya ri “U ṱavhanyedziswa ha u thoma U shumiswa ha AfCFTA ”, ḽi ḓo rangelwa phanḓa nga Dzulo Zwaḽo ḽa vhu42 ḽa Khorotshitumbe u bva nga ḽa 15 u swika ḽa 16 Luhuhi 2023.

src: Mhlonishwa Mengameli Yoweri Kaguta Museveni wase-Uganda utawungenela luhambo Lwembuso lwekuvakashela eNingizimu Afrika ngaLesibili, mhla tinge-28 Indlovana 2023, ngekutfobela simemo semlingani wakhe, Mengameli Ramaphosa.
tgt: Muṱhomphei Phresidennde Vho Yoweri Kaguta Museveni vha shango ḽa Uganda vha ḓo vha na madalo a Muvhuso kha shango ḽa Afrika Tshipembe nga Ḽavhuvhili, 28 Luhuhi 2023 nga murahu ha thambo u bva kha mushumisani navho, Phresidennde Vho Ramaphosa.

src: Imiklomelo Yemkhakha Webetindzaba Yenhlangano Yetekutfutfukiswa Kwemave Langaseningizimu ye-Afrika (i-SADC) yanga-2023 Ikhabhinethi ikhumbuta bonkhe bemkhakha webetindzaba kutsi kungena kulomkhosi weMiklomelo Yebetindzaba We-SADC wanga-2023, lokutawuvala ngaLesibili, mhla tinge-28 Indlovana 2023, kuvulekele tonkhe tintsatseli letivela emaveni langemalunga e-SADLeMiklomelo Yebetindzaba ye-SADC ihlonipha umsebenti lovelele wetetindzaba emkhakheni waletibhalwako, sitfombe, tamabonakudze newemsakato wemoya mayelana nekusabalalisa lwatiso lwe-SADC kwesekela lenchubo yekusebenta ngekubambisana kwalesigodzi nekuhlangana kulesigodzi.
tgt: Pfufho dza zwa Nyanḓadzamafhungo dza Mashango a Tshitshavha tsha Mveledziso a Tshipembe ha Afrika (SADC) dza ṅwaha wa 2023 Khabinethe i khou tsivhudza zwiimiswa zwoṱhe zwa nyanḓadzamafhungo uri zwa u dzhenela muṱaṱisano uyu wa Pfufho dza Nyanḓadzamafhungo dza ṅwaha wa 2023, zwine zwa khou vala nga Ḽavhuvhili, ḽa 28 Luhuhi 2023, zwazwino zwo vula kha vhoramafhungo vhoṱhe u bva kha mashango a miraḓo ya SADHedzi Pfufho dza Nyanḓadzamafhungo dza SADC dzi dzhiela nṱha mishumo ya khwinesa ya zwa nyanḓadzamafhungo kha masia a fanaho na khanḓiso, zwifanyiso, theḽevisheni na radio kha zwa u phaḓaladzwa ha mafhungo kha vhupo ha SADC u itela u tikedza maitele a tshumisano khathihi na u ṱanganelana ha dzingu.

src: Kuhalalisela.
tgt: U fhululedza.

src: Ikhabhinethi ihalalisela futsi ifisela lokuhle bo: Nomcebo Zikode, Zakes Bantwini na-Wouter Kellerman ngekuphumelela ekudlaleni umculo wemhlaba wengoma yabo letsi, Bayethe, emkhosini wanjalo ngemnyaka i-Annual Grammy Awards Ye-65.
tgt: Khabinethe i khou ṱahisa maipfi ayo a u fhululedza na u tamela mashudu mavhuya kha: Vho Nomcebo Zikode, Vho Zakes Bantwini na Vho Wouter Kellerman nge vha thuba pfufho ya u vha tshigwada tsha khwinesa kha khethekanyo ya muzwika wa ḽifhasi nga luimbo lwavho, Bayethe, kha vhuṱambo ha nga Ṅwaha ha Grammy Awards ha vhu.

src: Kudvudvuta Ikhabhinethi ivakalise emavi ekulilela nekudvudvuta imindeni nebangani: bemindeni yebantfu labasandza kushona ngesikhatsi ibhasi ishayisana nesitfutsi lesitfwala imali emgwacweni longutsela wayeka i-N1 eLimpopo.
tgt: Ndiliso Khabinethe yo ṱahisa maipfi a ndiliso kha vha muṱa na dzikhonani dza: vhathu vhe vha lovha zwenezwino musi basi ye vha vha vho i ṋamela i tshi thulana na veni ya u endedza tshelede nga tsha phanḓa kha gondo ḽa N1 highway fhaḽa Limpopo.

src: John Moeti (loneminyaka lenge-56), lobekangumdlali we-Bafana Bafana ne-Orlando Pirates, lowaba yincenye lenkhulu yelicembu lelaphumelela kutfola i-Africa Cup of Nations nga-1996.
tgt: Vho John Moeti (56), mutambi bola ya milenzhe wa kale wa Bafana Bafana na Orlando Pirates, vhe vha vha tshipiḓa tsha ndeme tsha thimu ye ya ḓo wina muṱaṱisano wa Tshiphuga tsha Dzitshaka dza Afrika nga ṅwaha wa 1996.

src: Ikhabhinethi iphindze yavakalisa emavi ayo ekulilela bohulumende nebantfu baseTürkiye neSyria labashonelwe bantfu labanyenti kakhulu baphindze bamoshakalelwa kakhulu kusakhiwonchanti setenhlalakahle netemnotfo ngenca yekutamatama kwemhlaba lokube kubi kakhulu kwamhla ti-6 Indlovana 2023 lokube ku-Richter Scale.
tgt: Khabinethe yo ṱahisa maipfi ayo a ndiliso kha muvhuso na vhathu vha shango ḽa Türkiye na ḽa Syria vhe vha welwa nga ndozwo khulwane ya matshilo a vhathu khathihi na tshinyalelo khulwane kha themamveledziso ya zwa matshilisano na ikonomi nga murahu ha mudzinginyo wa shango muhulu nga ḽa 6 Luhuhi 2023 we wa vha na tshikalo tsha kha Tshikalo tsha Richter.

src: Ikhabhinethi yetfulele sigcoko malunga eLuphiko Lwetemisebenti Yemaphoyisa LwaseNingizimu Afrika Lwe-K-9 ngemitamo yabo lenemandla, emkhatsini walokunye, leholele ekusindzisweni kwagogo loneminyaka lenge-80 budzala lohleti emalanga lasiphohlongo ngaphasi kwetindvonga letidzilikile eTürkiye.
tgt: Khabinethe yo dovha hafhu ya fhululedza miraḓo ya tshigwada tsha zwa dzimmbwa tsha vha Tshumelo ya Mapholisa ya Afrika Tshipembe tshi ḓivhiwaho sa K-9 vhe u shuma havho nga vhuhali, ha thusa vhukuma kha u phulusa mukegulu wa miṅwaha ya 80 vhe vha tshila nga fhasi ha maḓinga lwa tshifhinga tsha maḓuvha a fhiraho a malo ngei kha ḽa Türkiye.

src: UMnu Lucas Thabiso Thiti lobekwa waba Lisekela leMcondzisijikelele (i-DDG): kuLuphiko Lwekutfutfukisa Nekwesekela Sikhungo eTikweni Letebulungiswa Nekutfutfukiswa Kwemtsetfosisekelo.
tgt: Vho Lucas Thabiso Thiti sa Muthusa Mulangi Muhulu (DDG): Mveledziso na Thikhedzo ya Tshiimiswa kha Muhasho wa zwa Vhulamukanyi na Mveledziso ya Ndayotewa.

src: Mk Boitumelo Mosako ubekwe waba yi-CEO yeBhange leTekutfutfukisa laseNingizimu ye-Afrika.
tgt: Mufumakadzi Vho Boitumelo Mosako sa CEO wa Bannga ya Mveledziso ya Tshipembe ha Afrika.

src: UMnu Kabelo Rikhotso ubekwe waba nguMcondzi Lomkhulu eBhodini Yenhlangano Yahulumende Yetelutjalomali.
tgt: Vho Kabelo Rikhotso sa Mulanguli Muhulwane wa Bodo ya Koporasi ya Vhubindudzi ha Muvhuso.

src: UMnu Matsemela Moloi ubekwe waba nguMabhalane ku-Ejensi Lebukene Nekwephulwa Kwemitsetfo Yemgwaco.
tgt: Vho Matsemela Moloi sa Muṅwalisi wa Zhendedzi ḽa Vhutshinyi ha zwa Vhuendi ha Badani.

src: Adv Sonwabile Mancotywa lobekwe waba nguMcondzisi Longekho Esigungwini Lesiphetse lophindze futsi abe nguSihlalo we-Ejensi Yetetitfutsi Letiwela Iminyele.
tgt: Muambeli Vho Sonwabile Mancotywa sa Mulangulizwawe na Mudzulatshidulo wa Bodo ya zwa Vhuendi ha Badani vhu Pfukekanyaho Mikaṋo.

src: Issues In The Environment.
tgt: Issues In The Environment.

src: 2023 Budget Speech.
tgt: 2023 Budget Speech.

src: Cabinet welcomed the 2023 National Budget giving effect to critical interventions outlined by President Cyril Ramaphosa’s State of the Nation Address.
tgt: Cabinet welcomed the 2023 National Budget giving effect to critical interventions outlined by President Cyril Ramaphosa’s State of the Nation Address.

src: The Speech detailed plans to tackle the energy challenge, reduce unemployment, poverty and the rising cost of living, including combating crime and corruption.
tgt: The Speech detailed plans to tackle the energy challenge, reduce unemployment, poverty and the rising cost of living, including combating crime and corruption.

src: While balancing our commitments to fiscal discipline, the economic growth and investment and the social wage continues to receive the bulk of public resources, with R66 billion allocated to Social Development and R36 billion to fund the extension of the COVID-19 social relief of distress grant until 31 March 2024.
tgt: While balancing our commitments to fiscal discipline, the economic growth and investment and the social wage continues to receive the bulk of public resources, with R66 billion allocated to Social Development and R36 billion to fund the extension of the COVID-19 social relief of distress grant until 31 March 2024.

src: Furthermore, the increased allocations for all three spheres of government will help alleviate some of the financial pressures, particularly in health, education, and free basic services where the costs of providing services are rising.
tgt: Furthermore, the increased allocations for all three spheres of government will help alleviate some of the financial pressures, particularly in health, education, and free basic services where the costs of providing services are rising.

src: Quarterly Labour Force Survey Cabinet welcomed the Stats SA Quarterly Labour Force survey for fourth quarter of 2022, which showed a slight but significant decrease in the rate of unemployment in the country.
tgt: Quarterly Labour Force Survey Cabinet welcomed the Stats SA Quarterly Labour Force survey for fourth quarter of 2022, which showed a slight but significant decrease in the rate of unemployment in the country.

src: The official rate decreased by per cent from 32.9% to per cent.
tgt: The official rate decreased by per cent from 32.9% to per cent.

src: All sectors of society are called to drive job creation opportunities so that we can continue the downward trend in the unemployment rate as recorded over the last three quarters.
tgt: All sectors of society are called to drive job creation opportunities so that we can continue the downward trend in the unemployment rate as recorded over the last three quarters.

src: Through our collective effort, we can break the stubborn cycle of unemployment in our nation.
tgt: Through our collective effort, we can break the stubborn cycle of unemployment in our nation.

src: Government remains committed to the Economic Reconstruction and Recovery Plan (ERRP), which includes our mass public employment programme and efforts to support economic growth that bolsters employment after the devastation of COVID-.
tgt: Government remains committed to the Economic Reconstruction and Recovery Plan (ERRP), which includes our mass public employment programme and efforts to support economic growth that bolsters employment after the devastation of COVID-.

src: Deputy President Cabinet confirms that Deputy President David Mabuza has resigned as a Member of Parliament, ending his term as Deputy President of the country.
tgt: Deputy President Cabinet confirms that Deputy President David Mabuza has resigned as a Member of Parliament, ending his term as Deputy President of the country.

src: Cabinet joined President Cyril Ramaphosa in thanking him for his exceptional service to the country over the last five years.
tgt: Cabinet joined President Cyril Ramaphosa in thanking him for his exceptional service to the country over the last five years.

src: Deputy President Mabuza served with distinction and his contribution in building the country we want will forever be remembered by the people of South Africa.
tgt: Deputy President Mabuza served with distinction and his contribution in building the country we want will forever be remembered by the people of South Africa.

src: Energy.
tgt: Energy.

src: Cabinet understands the frustration of citizens and businesses over the inconvenience and disruptions caused by persistent load shedding.
tgt: Cabinet understands the frustration of citizens and businesses over the inconvenience and disruptions caused by persistent load shedding.

src: The commitments from the State of Nation Address and the Budget allocations strengthen the capability of the state to fast track interventions outlined in the Energy Action Plan.
tgt: The commitments from the State of Nation Address and the Budget allocations strengthen the capability of the state to fast track interventions outlined in the Energy Action Plan.

src: The recently published National State of Disaster regulations by the Minister of Cooperative Governance and Traditional Affairs allows government to respond more effectively and with the necessary pace to deal with the severe electricity supply constraints.
tgt: The recently published National State of Disaster regulations by the Minister of Cooperative Governance and Traditional Affairs allows government to respond more effectively and with the necessary pace to deal with the severe electricity supply constraints.

src: Moreover, it ensures transparency and accountability by enabling departments to guide their sectors.
tgt: Moreover, it ensures transparency and accountability by enabling departments to guide their sectors.

src: Regular progress updates will be provided.
tgt: Regular progress updates will be provided.

src: The debt relief of R254 billion, subject to strict conditions will relieve extreme pressure on Eskom and enable it to undertake necessary investment and maintenance.
tgt: The debt relief of R254 billion, subject to strict conditions will relieve extreme pressure on Eskom and enable it to undertake necessary investment and maintenance.

src: Tax incentives to rollout rooftop solar panels, not only assist households and businesses in generating electricity for their own use but also supports the national grid.
tgt: Tax incentives to rollout rooftop solar panels, not only assist households and businesses in generating electricity for their own use but also supports the national grid.

src: Under the expanded incentives for businesses, investments in renewable energy will allow businesses to claim a 125 per cent deduction in the first year for all renewable energy projects, with no thresholds on generation capacity.
tgt: Under the expanded incentives for businesses, investments in renewable energy will allow businesses to claim a 125 per cent deduction in the first year for all renewable energy projects, with no thresholds on generation capacity.

src: Wage Negotiations Cabinet calls upon all parties to remain committed to the process of the Public Service Co-Ordinating Bargaining Council Collective Agreement, and to arrive at a solution that serves the best interests of the country.
tgt: Wage Negotiations Cabinet calls upon all parties to remain committed to the process of the Public Service Co-Ordinating Bargaining Council Collective Agreement, and to arrive at a solution that serves the best interests of the country.

src: It is vitally important that we all work together for the good of our nation and her people.
tgt: It is vitally important that we all work together for the good of our nation and her people.

src: While the right to strike is protected, it must be done in a responsible manner that upholds our democracy and rule of law.
tgt: While the right to strike is protected, it must be done in a responsible manner that upholds our democracy and rule of law.

src: Cabinet reminds everyone that those who are planning to strike must do so in a peaceful manner, and should refrain from any form of intimidation and destruction of infrastructure and properties.
tgt: Cabinet reminds everyone that those who are planning to strike must do so in a peaceful manner, and should refrain from any form of intimidation and destruction of infrastructure and properties.

src: Anti-Corruption Cabinet joins President Cyril Ramaphosa in his call to the former Eskom CEO Andre de Ruyter to report allegations of corruption at Eskom to the police.
tgt: Anti-Corruption Cabinet joins President Cyril Ramaphosa in his call to the former Eskom CEO Andre de Ruyter to report allegations of corruption at Eskom to the police.

src: Our crime fighting institutions stand ready to arrest, and prosecute those who break the law.
tgt: Our crime fighting institutions stand ready to arrest, and prosecute those who break the law.

src: We call on anyone with information related to crime and corruption to report what they know to the relevant law enforcement authorities.
tgt: We call on anyone with information related to crime and corruption to report what they know to the relevant law enforcement authorities.

src: All of us are duty bound to fight corruption and to the prescripts of the Prevention and Combating of Corrupt Activities Act, which requires people in “positions of authority” in the public and private sectors to report, all corrupt activities.
tgt: All of us are duty bound to fight corruption and to the prescripts of the Prevention and Combating of Corrupt Activities Act, which requires people in “positions of authority” in the public and private sectors to report, all corrupt activities.

src: Financial Action Task Force (FATF).
tgt: Financial Action Task Force (FATF).

src: Cabinet noted the decision by the Financial Action Task Force (FATF) to list South Africa as a jurisdiction under increased monitoring or more commonly referred to as FATF’s “grey list”.
tgt: Cabinet noted the decision by the Financial Action Task Force (FATF) to list South Africa as a jurisdiction under increased monitoring or more commonly referred to as FATF’s “grey list”.

src: While the FATF recognised the significant progress made by the country in addressing the shortcomings highlighted in its mutual evaluation report (MER), it assessed that there is more needed to be done.
tgt: While the FATF recognised the significant progress made by the country in addressing the shortcomings highlighted in its mutual evaluation report (MER), it assessed that there is more needed to be done.

src: Cabinet is cognisant that addressing the identified shortcomings will be in the best interest of South Africa.
tgt: Cabinet is cognisant that addressing the identified shortcomings will be in the best interest of South Africa.

src: Government is committed to work swiftly to strengthen the effectiveness of its anti-money laundering and counter-terrorist financing regime.
tgt: Government is committed to work swiftly to strengthen the effectiveness of its anti-money laundering and counter-terrorist financing regime.

src: Ugandan State Visit.
tgt: Ugandan State Visit.

src: Cabinet welcomed the successful State Visit by President Yoweri Kaguta Museveni of the Republic of Uganda to South Africa on 28 February 2023.
tgt: Cabinet welcomed the successful State Visit by President Yoweri Kaguta Museveni of the Republic of Uganda to South Africa on 28 February 2023.

src: During the visit, the two Heads of State addressed a Business Forum, and explored trade and investment opportunities.
tgt: During the visit, the two Heads of State addressed a Business Forum, and explored trade and investment opportunities.

src: They also witnessed the signing of Memorandums of Understanding (MoU) on a number of areas, which included: Industrial Development Cooperation, Tourism Transport Communication Technologies Correctional Services and Women, Youth and Persons with Disabilities.
tgt: They also witnessed the signing of Memorandums of Understanding (MoU) on a number of areas, which included: Industrial Development Cooperation, Tourism Transport Communication Technologies Correctional Services and Women, Youth and Persons with Disabilities.

src: The Republic of Uganda is South Africa’s 15th largest trading partner on the Continent and the second largest in East Africa.
tgt: The Republic of Uganda is South Africa’s 15th largest trading partner on the Continent and the second largest in East Africa.

src: Between 2017 and 2021, total trade between the two countries reached R3 billion.
tgt: Between 2017 and 2021, total trade between the two countries reached R3 billion.

src: African Union (AU) Summit.
tgt: African Union (AU) Summit.

src: President Cyril Ramaphosa led the South African delegation at the African Union Summit in Ethiopia under the theme “Acceleration of Africa Continental Free Trade Area (AfCFTA) Implementation”.
tgt: President Cyril Ramaphosa led the South African delegation at the African Union Summit in Ethiopia under the theme “Acceleration of Africa Continental Free Trade Area (AfCFTA) Implementation”.

src: South Africa provided updates on the implementation of the African Continental Free Trade Area.
tgt: South Africa provided updates on the implementation of the African Continental Free Trade Area.

src: As Chair of the AU Peace and Security Council, the country also provided an update on progress towards Silencing the Guns in Africa by 2030.
tgt: As Chair of the AU Peace and Security Council, the country also provided an update on progress towards Silencing the Guns in Africa by 2030.

src: As AU COVID-19 Champion, President Ramaphosa presented proposals on how the Africa Centres for Disease Control (CDC) can be strengthened and measures adopted to better prepare the continent for pandemics.
tgt: As AU COVID-19 Champion, President Ramaphosa presented proposals on how the Africa Centres for Disease Control (CDC) can be strengthened and measures adopted to better prepare the continent for pandemics.

src: Under the leadership of President Ramaphosa, the COVID-19 African Vaccine Acquisition Task Team was established in support of the Africa Vaccine Strategy.
tgt: Under the leadership of President Ramaphosa, the COVID-19 African Vaccine Acquisition Task Team was established in support of the Africa Vaccine Strategy.

src: South Africa also secured over 500 million COVID-19 vaccine doses for the continent.
tgt: South Africa also secured over 500 million COVID-19 vaccine doses for the continent.

src: Further, the African Pandemic Response Fund was established, which mobilised $137 million for local production of vaccines, diagnostics, personal protective equipment, oxygen and critical medicines.
tgt: Further, the African Pandemic Response Fund was established, which mobilised $137 million for local production of vaccines, diagnostics, personal protective equipment, oxygen and critical medicines.

src: The Africa Medical Supplies Platform was also launched, to ensure access to vital medical supplies for all African countries.
tgt: The Africa Medical Supplies Platform was also launched, to ensure access to vital medical supplies for all African countries.

src: Gender-Based Violence and Femicide Government condemns the persistent cases of gender-based violence and femicide (GBVF) and continues to intensify its fight through several interventions.
tgt: Gender-Based Violence and Femicide Government condemns the persistent cases of gender-based violence and femicide (GBVF) and continues to intensify its fight through several interventions.

src: These include extensive legal reform, the establishment of a GBVF Response Fund, and support for Thuthuzela and Khuseleka Care Centres, which provide vital services for GBV survivors.
tgt: These include extensive legal reform, the establishment of a GBVF Response Fund, and support for Thuthuzela and Khuseleka Care Centres, which provide vital services for GBV survivors.

src: Furthermore, partnership that government has forged with civil society, business, development partners, the faith-based sector and other sectors to work together to deal with the scourge of GBVF, remain critical.
tgt: Furthermore, partnership that government has forged with civil society, business, development partners, the faith-based sector and other sectors to work together to deal with the scourge of GBVF, remain critical.

src: Health.
tgt: Health.
